title: Pallister W Syndrome: Clinical Overview and Characteristics
short_description: Clinical description of Pallister W syndrome, a rare genetic disorder characterized by distinctive facial features, developmental delays, and various physical abnormalities.
long_description: This document provides a comprehensive clinical overview of Pallister W syndrome, an extremely rare genetic disorder with only six reported cases as of 2000. The syndrome presents with characteristic facial dysmorphisms including hypertelorism, downslanting palpebral fissures, broad flat nasal bridge, and cleft palate or lip. Additional manifestations include intellectual disability, seizures, speech problems, skeletal abnormalities such as cubitus valgus, and neurological symptoms including tremor and spasticity. The document details the diagnostic features, prevalence, and clinical presentation of this congenital disorder that is apparent at birth.
